      The following mapping is maintained: 0 = BlockFace.WEST 1 = BlockFace.NORTH_WEST 2 = BlockFace.NORTH 3 = BlockFace.NORTH_EAST 4 = BlockFace.EAST 5 = BlockFace.SOUTH_EAST 6 = BlockFace.SOUTH 7 = BlockFace.SOUTH_WEST 8 = BlockFace.WEST 9 = BlockFace.NORTH_WEST etc.

    • Method Detail

      • faceToNotch

        public static int faceToNotch(org.bukkit.block.BlockFace face)
        Gets the Notch integer representation of a BlockFace
        These are the horizontal faces, which exclude up and down, and sub-faces

        The following mapping is maintained:
        • BlockFace.WEST = 0
        • BlockFace.NORTH_WEST = 1
        • BlockFace.NORTH = 2
        • BlockFace.NORTH_EAST = 3
        • BlockFace.EAST = 4
        • BlockFace.SOUTH_EAST = 5
        • BlockFace.SOUTH = 6
        • BlockFace.SOUTH_WEST = 7
        • Invalid = 0
        Parameters:
        face - to get
        Returns:
        Notch of the face

      • isAlongX

        public static boolean isAlongX(org.bukkit.block.BlockFace face)
        Checks whether a given face is an offset along the X-axis. This is true for:
        • BlockFace.EAST
        • BlockFace.WEST
        Parameters:
        face - to check
        Returns:
        True if it is along the X-axis, False if not

      • isAlongY

        public static boolean isAlongY(org.bukkit.block.BlockFace face)
        Checks whether a given face is an offset along the Y-axis. This is true for:
        • BlockFace.UP
        • BlockFace.DOWN
        Parameters:
        face - to check
        Returns:
        True if it is along the Y-axis, False if not

      • isAlongZ

        public static boolean isAlongZ(org.bukkit.block.BlockFace face)
        Checks whether a given face is an offset along the Z-axis. This is true for:
        • BlockFace.SOUTH
        • BlockFace.NORTH
        Parameters:
        face - to check
        Returns:
        True if it is along the Z-axis, False if not

      • notchToFace

        public static org.bukkit.block.BlockFace notchToFace(int notch)
        Gets the Block Face at the notch index modulus 8 specified
        These are the horizontal faces, which exclude up and down, and sub-faces

        The following mapping is maintained:
        • 0 = BlockFace.WEST
        • 1 = BlockFace.NORTH_WEST
        • 2 = BlockFace.NORTH
        • 3 = BlockFace.NORTH_EAST
        • 4 = BlockFace.EAST
        • 5 = BlockFace.SOUTH_EAST
        • 6 = BlockFace.SOUTH
        • 7 = BlockFace.SOUTH_WEST
        • 8 = BlockFace.WEST
        • 9 = BlockFace.NORTH_WEST
        • etc.
        Parameters:
        notch - to get
        Returns:
        BlockFace of the notch

      • notchFaceOffset

        public static org.bukkit.block.BlockFace notchFaceOffset(org.bukkit.block.BlockFace face,
                                                         int notchOffset)
        Adds a certain amount of notches (n of 45-degree angles) to a BlockFace
        Parameters:
        face - input
        notchOffset - to offset the input by
        Returns:
        face input offset by notchOffset notches

      • rotate

        public static org.bukkit.block.BlockFace rotate(org.bukkit.block.BlockFace from,
                                                int notchCount)
        Rotates a given Block Face horizontally
        Parameters:
        from - face
        notchCount - to rotate at
        Returns:
        rotated face

      • combine

        public static org.bukkit.block.BlockFace combine(org.bukkit.block.BlockFace from,
                                                 org.bukkit.block.BlockFace to)
        Combines two non-subcardinal faces into one face
        - NORTH and WEST returns NORTH_WEST
        - NORTH and SOUTH returns NORTH (not possible to combine)
        Parameters:
        from - face to combined
        to - face to combined
        Returns:
        the combined face

      • getFaces

        public static org.bukkit.block.BlockFace[] getFaces(org.bukkit.block.BlockFace main)
        Gets all the individual faces represented by a Block Face
        - NORTH_WEST returns NORTH and WEST
        - NORTH returns NORTH and SOUTH
        Parameters:
        main - face to get the faces for
        Returns:
        an array of length 2 containing all the faces

      • getRailsCartDirection

        Parameters:
        raildirection - of the rails
        Returns:
        minecart direction

      • toRailsDirection

        public static org.bukkit.block.BlockFace toRailsDirection(org.bukkit.block.BlockFace direction)
        Gets the rail direction from a Direction
        NORTH becomes SOUTH and WEST becomes EAST
        Parameters:
        direction - to convert
        Returns:
        rail direction

      • isSubCardinal

        public static boolean isSubCardinal(org.bukkit.block.BlockFace face)
        Gets whether a given Block Face is sub-cardinal (such as NORTH_WEST)
        Parameters:
        face - to check
        Returns:
        True if sub-cardinal, False if not

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • getVertical

        public static org.bukkit.block.BlockFace getVertical(double dy)
        Gets the BlockFace.UP or BlockFace.DOWN based on the delta-y parameter
        Parameters:
        dy - parameter
        Returns:
        UP if dy >= 0, DOWN if dy < 0

      • hasSubDifference

        public static boolean hasSubDifference(org.bukkit.block.BlockFace face1,
                                       org.bukkit.block.BlockFace face2)
        Gets whether two faces have a sub-cardinal difference or less
        Parameters:
        face1 - to check
        face2 - to check
        Returns:
        True if the difference <= 45 degrees

        Returns:

      • faceToYaw

        public static int faceToYaw(org.bukkit.block.BlockFace face)
        Gets the angle from a horizontal Block Face. The following mapping is used:
      • BlockFace.WEST = 0
      • BlockFace.NORTH_WEST = 45
      • BlockFace.NORTH = 90
      • BlockFace.NORTH_EAST = 135
      • BlockFace.EAST = 180
      • BlockFace.SOUTH_EAST = -135
      • BlockFace.SOUTH = -90
      • BlockFace.SOUTH_WEST = -45
      • Invalid = 0
Parameters:
face - to get the angle for
Returns:
face angle

  • yawToFace

    public static org.bukkit.block.BlockFace yawToFace(float yaw)
    Gets the horizontal Block Face from a given yaw angle
    This includes the NORTH_WEST faces
    Parameters:
    yaw - angle
    Returns:
    The Block Face of the angle

  • yawToFace

    public static org.bukkit.block.BlockFace yawToFace(float yaw,
                                                   boolean useSubCardinalDirections)
    Gets the horizontal Block Face from a given yaw angle
    Parameters:
    yaw - angle
    useSubCardinalDirections - setting, True to allow NORTH_WEST to be returned
    Returns:
    The Block Face of the angle
